deepen.translation[0].definitions[0].def: if a serious situation deepens, it gets worse – used especially in news reports
deepen.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to become stronger or greater, or to make something stronger or greater
deepen.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Jeanne liked Simon as a friend but she did not want the relationship to deepen.
The idea only deepened his gloom.
The mystery deepened  (=became even more mysterious).
Students explore new ideas as they deepen their understanding  (=understand more) of the subject.
deepen.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if someone’s smile or frown deepens, they smile even more or frown even more
deepen.translation[0].definitions[3].def: if water deepens, or if someone deepens it, it becomes deeper
deepen.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The river deepens beyond the town.
The harbour was deepened to take bigger boats.
deepen.translation[0].definitions[4].def: if light or a colour deepens, it becomes darker
deepen.translation[0].definitions[5].def: if a sound deepens, it becomes lower
deepen.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: His voice deepened as he relaxed.
deepen.translation[0].definitions[6].def: if your breathing deepens, you take more air into your lungs
